Articles.Content:
Moderator Notice: The original poster has become inactive and will probably not notice bumps to this topic. If you want to get in contact with EatthePath, PLEASE private message him first so this topic doesn't get bumped unnecessarily.

An alternative to the tricoupler, this lets you run a side-by-side triple stack without fiddling with radial decouplers. Comes with variants at different angles to allow some extra design freedom.

Updated with a full range of angles at 15 degree increments. Saddly compatibility was broken with old saved ships to make the parts sort usefully in the panel. Sorry about that, I don't intend to break compatibility again.

Mirror File: http://www./download.php?c7rbdvbu73yn7y4

^Download link courtesy of dishycourier

Edited September 12, 2012 by deadshot462
Clarification

I love these parts more than I love bread, and I love bread. A lot.

Just sayin'.

Just wanted to say (since my praise in the other thread was locked) that I like these parts quite a bit and hope to see some more from you.

Also, I can't figure out how to Orky these, they're so smooth and hi-tech.

just wanted to bump - making sure these parts get the attention they deserve. i find them highly useful.

also, wanted to request if you can make some X-shaped parts to go along with the set ;D

I just tried to make the same 9 engine setup as in the OP's pic(without the 3 decouplers), but with liquid enigines. Unfortunately there seems to be a bug as the parts just rip themselves apart at seemingly random times. Even turning the engines completely off doesn't stop it, so I assume it's a collision problem.
It seems somehow since I last downloaded this part that the copy on the website has gotten corrupted, so I\'m uploading my version of it since it\'s a prerequisite for my rockets.
The download link seems to be broken, keeps wanting to dl the index.php :-) Hope I can get hold of this pack soon, thank you!

The download link seems to be broken, keeps wanting to dl the index.php :-) Hope I can get hold of this pack soon, thank you!

Update your Firefox.

Update your Firefox.

LOL, yeah, I saw firefox mentioned in another thread as the cause to that particular sillyness, I just downloaded with IE and was about to update my post :-) Thank you for replying with a fix so quickly though!

Love the pack as well OP! Very Very useful for all my catastrophic rocket builds
D: i cant download it all the links seem blank aw man it looks so sweet to

D: i cant download it all the links seem blank aw man it looks so sweet to

Unfortunately, neither can anyone else. This file appears not to have survived the move. You should PM the OP and see if they can reupload it. I had this part a long time ago and might have it in a download folder somewhere, but until someone else has it available, the mods are just going to tell you not to bump necro threads.

So, PM EatThePath and see if he/she is interested in updating it.

EDIT: I do have this. As this mod is dead and the OP is MIA, I am rehosting this on my mediafire entirely in its original form.

http://www./download.php?c7rbdvbu73yn7y4

Note to mods: Please nuke the url if this is inappropriate. In the spirit of community, I have simply mirrored the file.

Edited September 12, 2012 by dishycourier

Ok, I'm new to using .rar files(downloaded the free version of WinZip just for this) and as such I have a bunch of OBJ, PNG, MTl and CFG files that I have no idea what to do with. I'm totally confused as what to put where and how.

Could you perhaps explain to me what I do from here? Thanks in advance!

Ok, I'm new to using .rar files(downloaded the free version of WinZip just for this) and as such I have a bunch of OBJ, PNG, MTl and CFG files that I have no idea what to do with. I'm totally confused as what to put where and how.

Could you perhaps explain to me what I do from here? Thanks in advance!

Just take all of the folders in the root of the archive and dump them in the Parts folder in your ksp. I'd also recommend winrar and 7zip. an autoinstaller can be found at ninite.com. Just select winrar and 7zip, download your ninite app and it will install everything for you.
Necro much?

Just take all of the folders in the root of the archive and dump them in the Parts folder in your ksp. I'd also recommend winrar and 7zip. an autoinstaller can be found at ninite.com. Just select winrar and 7zip, download your ninite app and it will install everything for you.

Thanks. I felt a little daft when I saw how that ended up(all the files were in named folders like all the other parts.)

Oh and thanks for suggesting winrar and 7zip. I can open and use them without annoying "BUY NOW!" banners and auto-opening a webpage saying how much the paid version rocks...

Unfortunately, neither can anyone else. This file appears not to have survived the move. You should PM the OP and see if they can reupload it. hey thanks for the link this part looks amazing

Why do u people keep necroing the topics. There are so old but u guys dont ever listen!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Stop necroing the old topics at once. I think this topic should die now!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I for one am glad it was necro'd, it's a really good looking coupler

Moderator Comment: For once, this necro-bump was excusable. The download link was broken and it is quite in order to request that it be mended. It would have been better to P.M. the O.P., but a request in the thread is acceptable.

Yeah this should have been closed a while back, oh well, can't stop them all.

Unfortunately none of you could add anything really new to this thread, and it seems EatThePath has not come back since the move to vBuletin which is a shame.

Also, dishycourier, EatThePath put this in his add-on:

License: distribute as you please, just don't strip out the credit.

So your Mediafire link is fine

Should EatThePath return, he can PM any mod to reopen this thread.

Edited September 12, 2012 by sal_vager
